content.webTitle: Spirit Group mulls over bids for its 1,800 pubs

fields.headline: Spirit Group mulls over bids for its 1,800 pubs
fields.bodyText: Spirit Group, the privately-owned pubs operator, is going to take until the middle of next month to examine all the bids it has received. The company, which manages more than 1,800 pubs, is believed to have been approached by property tycoon Robert Tchenguiz, former WestLB banker Robin Saunders and Australian bank Macquarie. "We want to know whether these are serious approaches by mid-November," explained chief executive Karen Jones, right. The group said like-for-like performance for the quarter to August 20 rose 3.9% with sales in the subsequent eight weeks up 3.2%.
